title: Salt Cured Egg Yolks
steps: Pour ½ inch of salt into a glass or stoneware baking dish.
Use a spoon to create small indentations for each yolk, keeping them ¼ inch apart.
Carefully separate eggs and place yolks in divots.
Cover yolks completely with salt (should be invisible under salt).
Remove yolks from salt and dust off excess with a damp towel.
Wrap yolks in cheesecloth, separated by butcher's twine to maintain airflow.
Hang in a cool location (below 50°F, preferably in refrigerator) for 7-10 days.
Yolks should be firm but still grate-able (not rock hard).
notes: Creates rich, salty, tangy toppings through salt curing and air drying
Total time is 14-17 days (7 days curing + 7-10 days drying)
Grate over pasta, salads, or desserts as a dairy-free cheese alternative
Yolks have a salty-sweet flavor profile
